body.p:
His Excellency B. Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Oldham County would respectfully state to your Excellency that at the September Term 1861 of the Oldham Circuit Court Richard R. Mack of said County was fined at the sum of Twenty dollars upon an Indictment for unlawful gaming The facts elected in the evidence showed that said Mack and some two or three others were engaged in a game of card, and that the amount for which they were playing was very small (only a few cents) We farther state that we have long known Mr Mack and know that he has always born the character of a industrious young man, and that he has never merited the character of a gambler. The amount however small in which he has been fined will be a serious loss to himself and family if coerced and we therefore respectfully ask your Excellency to remit the said fine.

J W Clayton
